forecast.name: Overnight
forecast.detailedForecast: A slight chance of drizzle. Mostly cloudy, with a low around 54. West southwest wind around 15 mph, with gusts as high as 18 mph. Chance of precipitation is 20%.

forecast.name: Monday
forecast.shortForecast: Slight Chance Drizzle then Mostly Sunny
forecast.detailedForecast: A slight chance of drizzle before 11am. Mostly sunny. High near 64, with temperatures falling to around 61 in the afternoon. West southwest wind 12 to 23 mph, with gusts as high as 29 mph. Chance of precipitation is 20%.

weather_report:
The skies over Downtown San Francisco find themselves cloaked in a muted embrace as the early morning unfolds. A gentle shroud of clouds drifts lazily overhead, intermittently teasing the possibility of drizzle—a reminder of the coastal influence that often kisses these streets. With temperatures languishing around a comfortable mid-fifties, one can sense a hint of briskness in the air, carried aloft by whispering winds from the west, punctuated by occasional stronger gusts that create just enough movement to invigorate the spirit.

As the day progresses, the sun will begin to break through the cloud cover, casting its genial warmth upon the city. Anticipate a transition, where the bright promise of a mostly sunny afternoon hovers near a mild sixty-four degrees, a backdrop for the gentle stirrings of urban life. Residents and visitors alike may find the air still holds traces of the marine layer, softening the edges of iconic landmarks while inviting one to don a light jacket or sweater, shedding layers as the day warms. Strolls along the waterfront or meandering through local cafes to savor a warm cup of coffee would be fitting pursuits as this serene day unfurls. 

A walk through Golden Gate Park, with its sprawling greenery, or a quiet moment spent in one of the neighborhoods that hum with creativity and life, could create the perfect early June memory in a city that holds so many stories.
